body.name: Smart Doorbell Elite/Pro Button Replacement (Ring Compatible) (1)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 32 mins
features: Brand new Smart Doorbell Pro Replacement Button
Uses a material that has UV stabliser in so it won't crack
Material allows infrared to pass through so the sensor fully works unlike the cheap 3d printed buttons. Night Vision will still work fine.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #100,532 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement) #75 in Door Bell Push Buttons

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: HOW TO INSTALL Four screws from the back of the main housing.Four screws to the main board (two black, two silver screws)Detach three connectors (two white and one black, carefully)Do not remove any other connectors as they a small and very easy to break or damage.Only tilt main circuit board forward, this reveals the back of the push buttonUnscrew the screw that holds the centre of button.Now, button drops out the front and you can careful remove broken cover, gently pry off old button cover.Line up new button cover to the base of the button mount.Carefully. As it’s still on a circuit ribbon, you don’t want to tug it.Once new cover is lined up. Refit button (don’t forget the spring) and refit unit

**Update** - Lots of customers have had great luck, just pulling out the cracked button with pliers and then lining up the new button and pushing it into place. Please make sure you are careful pulling it out and just the button, then just make sure the new button alignment holes are aligned correctly before pushing in place.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Replaced without disassembly
reviews.reviewText: The face of the original button broke in two and eventually came off in the hand of a delivery person when they rang the doorbell. (It had been cracked for over a year). I was able to gently remove the rest of the button with a pair of needle nose pliers (the circular portion in the attached photo). Gently is the important word here. Note how it comes out because it likely only goes back on one way. (There is a notch in the new cover (not one of the slots!) that went towards the bottom on my Ring Pro 2.).The comment from the seller that lots of people were able to replace the buttons without dis assembling the unit made me try doing it, and it worked!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Broke after used once
reviews.reviewText: The original button lasted 4 years. We put the new button in and it last one push. It cracked right down the middle. I’ve added some black electrical tape over the crack to hold it together until I find another solution.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just as described.
reviews.reviewText: Remove old button with pliers, push on new button. Took 30 seconds and it works great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This product worked perfectly and allows the sensor behind the button to work
reviews.reviewText: There are a lot of mixed reviews on these replacement buttons. I found this one that offered a decent price and free returns if it didn't work. That price is why I dropped it to 4 stars.There is a vide on YouTube about removing the old button. It's not hard but you do have to go slow so you don't damage anything. Getting the old button off required me to clip away the old button plastic to free it up. But again, go slow and you are in good shape.The replacement button snapped right on perfectly and locked in like it should. When you put the physical button back into the doorbell, you have a black screw to hold it in place. That screw does not get tightened all the way. It's also used to make the metal contact to tell the doorbell that someone pushed the button. Tighten it only until the small tab comes through the notch to keep the button from spinning or moving.The sensor works perfectly through the button and the material was not cracked as some prior comments described. I ended up buying a second one just as a backup. Why Ring doesn't offer a replacement button is surprising and they wanted to give me a discount on a new multi-hundred dollar doorbell. This was definitely the way to go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Low Quality product, not recommended
reviews.reviewText: This button replacement is so fragile and cracked before install. Very cheaply made product and very expensive. The plastic was not at all flexible to fit and extremely fragile. Do not purchase at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Replacement button is translucent enough for sensor behind it. Also despite an in depth installation procedure found on you tube to replace the button it was far cheaper then a purchasing a new unit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This button replacement is brittle and cracked before install. Very cheaply made product. The plastic was not at all flexible to fit and extremely fragile. Do not purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Charging $14 for a plastic button is RIDICULOUS
reviews.reviewText: Amazon / Ring should be embarrassed with charging so much for a small piece of plastic. I worked in the plastics industry and this is nothing short of theft, but when you need to replace the button, you have no choice.

This might work perfectly well but it’s important to note that you have to dismantle the ring from the electrical wiring in order to replace this piece so it’s annoying to installBut I’m sure works great
